history.text: Hello!  How's your day?
Pretty good! How is yours?
Great thanks!  :)   So it looks like we'll be talking about Maleficent today, I loved this movie.  How about you?
Yes, I enjoyed it. Very different from the cartoon sleeping beauty, I liked seeing her side of the story.
Who was the guy who cut off her wings again?
Yes, I really liked seeing the story from the other perspective too.
What I felt annoying what the 4 fairies... they were so slow
that was Stefan who cut off her wings
I liked the 4 fairies at the end, but through most of the movie they were just annoying as you say
Stefan ! Yes he was horrible to Maleficent. Betray for power, classic story line
yes... I was very surprised to find myself being sympathetic with the character who is the bad guy (or girl, I guess)
at the beginning of the movie, when she meets Stefan in the forest, you think that they're going to be life-long friends, and it just broke my heart when he betrayed her like that
yea a lot of movies these days make you feel sympathy for the “villain”
yes, I suppose that is a fairly popular theme these days
Yea mans greed, destroying friendships. Who was your favorite character ?
I think Maleficent was probably my favorite, but I also liked the raven Diaval
I love how she just turns him into whatever she wants, even though it irks him   LOL
Mine too! He added humor to the movie. He was the one who actually took care of aurora lol
yes exactly
What did you think about the CGI when she turns into a dragon ?
Oh I really loved that!  Stunning effects all the way through the movie
I also really appreciated all the twists and turns in this movie
it's a story we all know so well, but it never really went the direction you thought it would
Agreed! When they show where she lives , with all the mystical creatures. Looked like a very nice place existz
Yes, even though I knew the scenery was all CGI, I kept finding myself thinking that I would love to visit there
Right , when I first saw the trailer I thought it was gonna be her , seeking revenge taking a much more darker tone but I was wrong

exactly!  And then when it's revealed that the only way to break the curse is by true love's kiss, you expect it to be the guy Aurora met in the woods, and I was totally surprised that it was Maleficent's kiss that did it
kept me guessing til the very end, and I love that
I often wondered why people think locking up their child would kept them safe... lol
I agree
I think the scene with the room that had all the broken spinning wheels was great, it really creeped me out
Didn’t they light a fire of all of them ?
even though I knew what was going to happen, I actually sat there yelling "no! no! don't touch the stupid thing!"   Yes, and then one of them reassembled itself from the pieces
Magic!
it truly was
What age was it that the it would take affect
and then the fight scene after Maleficent got her wings back, that was thrilling
16, wasn't it?
Yes that’s what it was 16.
Well it was nice talking to you about the movie :)
you too!  :)
Have a good day!

uid1response.feedback: Excellent movie, and a very good partner to chat with!
